intro: Dumerilia axillaris, commonly known as the slender false holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in dense inflorescences. Dumerilia axillaris is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
